intro: Ruehssia suberosa, commonly known as the woolly ruehssia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. Ruehssia suberosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
